content.question: The Green Revolution led to an increase in food production in many places around the world, but there have been some negative consequences. Which of the following explains one of the negative consequences of the Green Revolution that would be of greater concern for people in developing countries than for people in more-developed countries?

choices.label: Runoff of agricultural chemicals into the local groundwater that pollutes water resources
Excess production of grain products for which there is no market
Increase in the acreage used for agriculture that affects the open space surrounding villages
Collapse of the grain export market that results in farm foreclosures
Double-cropping processes that lead to soil erosion and a decline in soil fertility

content.answer: Runoff of agricultural chemicals into the local groundwater that pollutes water resources
